abstract_summ: This letter to the editor remarks on additional considerations for the management of febrile neutropenia during the COVID‐19 pandemic, in response to the letter by Boutayeb et al.[This corrects the article DOI: 10.1186/s40560-020-00445-4.].[This corrects the article DOI: 10.1038/s41392-020-0148-4.].The affiliation of the authorAn amendment to this paper has been published and can be accessed via a link at the top of the paper.[This corrects the article DOI: 10.1021/acscentsci.0c00489.].A decline in the number of hospital admissions for acute coronary syndrome was observed across Italy and USA during the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic.The paper describes the results of an ESC Covid survey.[This corrects the article DOI: 10.21037/atm-20-3754.].The authors regret a mistake in Table 1.[This corrects the article DOI: 10.1186/s40545-020-00219-1.].An amendment to this paper has been published and can be accessed via a link at the top of the paper.Comorbid hypertension correlates with poorer outcomes in patients with Covid-19.There is a Blood Commentary on this article in this issue.Martin Aepfelbacher is affiliated to the Institute of Microbiology, University Medical Center Hamburg-Eppendorf, Hamburg, Germany, instead.
